review: The Fire TV Stick is "not compatible" with my older TV -- I get video, but no audio. I plugged it into the HDMI port as instructed, but neither of the two Sticks I ordered had audio. Amazon customer service was extremely helpful -- couldn't have been better -- but there is nothing I can do about this issue. Amazon should tell people that the Stick might not work with older TVs, even if they have HDMI ports. Bummer.UPDATED: I finally figured out that I had to change a sound setting on the TV itself to get the Fire Stick sound to work. Amazon never suggested this, even though I was on the phone with them for 2+ hours. Hopefully they will train their tech staff more completely in the future. Now that I can hear the programming, it works great so far.
author: Mom in Phoenix

review: WARNING : It does not work with HDMI extenders.I purchased a 8" HDMI female to male extender. No big deal right.About 10 minutes into a stream, you will get a "HDCP unauthorized. Content Disabled."
author: philip

review: I'm disappointed in the Fire TV Stick. It works great and I have no complaints in that regard.  But as an owner of four Rokus and an Apple TV, I find the screens much more cluttered.  I honestly would prefer less promotion of movies and TV shows in my face on the home screen.  If I want hints on what to watch, just give me one space below the home screen to get those.  I also don't like the scrolling across long rows of apps.  I much prefer the grid layout of the Roku and Apple TV.  Roku abandoned the scrolling interface quite awhile ago.  I felt I was moving backwards as regards the interface.I haven't used the games much yet, but I suspect my sons will enjoy those apps.In sum, the device works great right out the box, but the interface is atrocious and needs a lot of work.
author: Gregory K. Laughlin "GL"

review: What can I say? Plug it in and it just works!  It immediately found my network and connected.  Now I have Netflix, Amazon Prime and a whole host of other sites available at the click of a remote. Absolutely a must for Cord Cutters!
author: 38ChevyGuy

review: I love this product!  It was super easy to install and works just as described.  Previously, I had ordred Chromcast and it didn't work on my tv because it is an older model plasma that isn't a "smart tv".  I took a chance on the Fire Stick and I was delighted when it worked.  It literally took 5 minutes for me to set this up and have it running on my tv.  I love it!
author: Barbara J Brown

review: not a fan of the interface.. Roku is much faster to navigate despite the processor being slower..  Fire compensates for the faster processor with having to go through around 2-3 more steps to achieve what roku does.  Unplugged it and will use it on an extra device or use it as a bookmark.  This also gets hot.. really hot.  I made the mistake of having it too close to my roku stick and it made the roku glitch from the heat (which is how I noticed it).  having to have external power rather than taking advantage of mhl seems like a step back also.

Great job Amazon!!!My only complaint is that they're on backorder until January!!! My parents saw mine and my brother's, and now they wanted one...
